steps.title: Junior + AI
steps.narration: A junior with AI is a faster junior. They ask AI how to do X. They debug AI output line by line. The AI helps, but it's still a junior working faster.

steps.title: Your Experience
steps.narration: But you have something juniors don't: years of pattern recognition. System design intuition. The ability to spot architectural problems at a glance. This changes everything.

steps.title: The Multiplier
steps.narration: AI doesn't replace senior engineers‚Äîit multiplies them. Experience times AI amplification equals unprecedented capability. Ten years of experience times AI equals 100x impact.

steps.title: Senior + AI
steps.narration: You don't ask AI how to code. You direct AI to implement your design. You validate AI output instantly because you've seen these patterns thousands of times before.

steps.title: A New Category
steps.narration: A senior with AI is an entirely different category of engineer. Your years of experience become superpowers when combined with AI velocity. This is your unfair advantage.

steps.title: Traditional Senior Role
steps.narration: In the traditional model, senior engineers create value through doing. Write the most complex code. Be the bottleneck for hard problems. Review code line by line.

steps.title: Individual Output
steps.narration: Value equals individual output. How much code can you write? How many bugs can you fix? This model is about to become obsolete.

steps.title: AI-Amplified Senior
steps.narration: The new paradigm: value through directing. You design systems, AI implements. You review at the architectural level while AI catches the details.

steps.title: Team Amplification
steps.narration: Value equals team amplification. How many problems can you multiply your solving across the team? Mentoring becomes teaching AI leverage. Your impact scales.

steps.title: The Architect Role
steps.narration: This is the evolution: from senior engineer who does, to senior architect who directs. Your experience becomes the compass. AI becomes the velocity.

steps.title: Four Strategies
steps.narration: This course teaches four strategic approaches to multiply your impact. These aren't about using AI‚Äîthey're about leveraging AI with your experience.

steps.title: Rapid Acquisition
steps.narration: Strategy one: Understand any codebase in hours, not weeks. AI maps dependencies, traces data flows, identifies patterns‚Äîwith you as the navigator. Chapter 1.

steps.title: System-Wide Debugging
steps.narration: Strategy two: Trace bugs across service boundaries. Root cause analysis at scale. Turn days of investigation into hours. Chapter 2.

steps.title: Platform Integration
steps.narration: Strategy three: Design robust integration points. AI generates the glue code while you focus on contracts and error handling strategies. Chapter 3.

steps.title: Architectural Direction
steps.narration: Strategy four: Express architectural intent, let AI draft implementation. Your design decisions, AI's execution speed. This is the amplification point. Chapter 4.

questions.question: What's the key difference between a junior with AI and a senior with AI?
options: Seniors use more expensive AI tools
Juniors ask AI 'how'; seniors direct AI with architectural intent
Seniors don't need AI because they know everything
Juniors get faster results from AI
questions.explanation: Juniors ask AI how to do X and debug output line-by-line. Seniors direct AI to implement their design and validate output instantly from years of pattern recognition.

questions.question: According to the multiplier effect, what happens when you combine experience with AI?
options: AI replaces the need for experience
questions.explanation: AI doesn't replace senior engineers‚Äîit multiplies them. Your years of experience become superpowers when combined with AI velocity, creating unprecedented capability.

questions.question: Why can seniors validate AI output faster than juniors?
options: They've seen these patterns thousands of times before
questions.explanation: Seniors have years of pattern recognition built up. They can spot architectural problems at a glance because they've encountered similar patterns many times before.

questions.question: In the traditional senior model, how is value measured?
questions.explanation: The traditional model values individual output‚Äîhow much complex code can you write, how many bugs can you fix. This model is being transformed by AI.

questions.question: In the AI-amplified model, what becomes the new measure of value?
questions.explanation: In the new paradigm, value equals team amplification. How many problems can you multiply your problem-solving across? Your impact scales through directing rather than doing.

questions.question: What does 'mentoring = teaching AI leverage' mean?
options: Seniors teach juniors how to use AI as a thinking partner and multiplier
AI replaces the need for mentoring
Juniors should teach seniors about AI
questions.explanation: In the new paradigm, senior mentoring evolves from pairing sessions to teaching how to leverage AI effectively. You help juniors understand how to direct AI rather than just use it.

questions.question: What does 'Rapid Acquisition' refer to in this course?
options: Understanding any codebase in hours instead of weeks
questions.explanation: Rapid Acquisition is the ability to understand any codebase in hours, not weeks. AI maps dependencies and traces data flows while you navigate and interpret the patterns.

questions.question: In 'Architectural Direction' (Strategy 4), what does the senior engineer do?
options: Expresses architectural intent while AI drafts implementation
Lets AI make all design decisions
Reviews AI output line by line
questions.explanation: Architectural Direction means you express the intent and make design decisions while AI handles execution speed. Your design, AI's velocity.

questions.question: How does 'Platform Integration' work with AI?
options: You design contracts and error handling, AI generates glue code
No AI is used for integrations
AI replaces the need for integration
questions.explanation: In Platform Integration, you focus on the important parts‚Äîcontracts and error handling strategies‚Äîwhile AI generates the glue code. Strategic division of labor.
